nurQuran.title: ðŸŒ™âœ¨ Nur al-Qur'an â€“ The Healing Light ðŸŒ™âœ¨
nurQuran.intro:
Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Rahim

Approach your heart and open your soul. Here begins Nur al-Qur'an, the light of the Quran, divine breath that purifies, soothes and heals. Each recited verse is a gentle flame that dispels inner darkness, each word is a balm for the spirit and heart.

Feel the presence of Allah through each syllable, let this light penetrate your visible and invisible wounds. Be humble, be patient, and allow the light of the Quran to free your soul from anxiety, heaviness and all evil that oppresses you.

Each recitation is a direct connection with the Supreme Healer, each breath a step towards serenity.
Immerse yourself in the light, and let Allah heal.

deblocage.description: To remove inner knots, heaviness and psychological tensions.

1.transliteration:
Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem
Alam nashrah laka sadrak
Wa wada'na 'anka wizraka
Alladhi anqada zahrak
Wa rafa'na laka dhikrak
Fa-inna ma'al-'usri yusra
Inna ma'al-'usri yusra
Fa-itha faraghta fansab
Wa ila rabbika farghab
1.translation:
"Have We not opened your breast?
And removed your burden that weighed on your back?
And raised high your renown?
So, with hardship comes ease.
When you are free, devote yourself to your work and turn to your Lord."

2.translation:
"Your Lord has neither forsaken you nor hated you.
The future will be better for you than the past.
He found you lost and guided you, found you in need and enriched you.
Take care of orphans, help the needy and speak of your Lord's blessings."

1.translation:
"In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Master of the Day of Judgment.
You alone we worship and You alone we ask for help.
Guide us to the straight path,
the path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked anger or of those who are astray."

2.translation: "Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great."

3.translation:
"The Messenger believes in what has been revealed to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each believes in Allah, His angels, His books and His messengers. They make no distinction between any of His messengers and say: 'We have heard and we have obeyed. Grant us forgiveness, Lord, and to You is the return.'
Allah does not burden any soul beyond its capacity. It will be rewarded for what it has earned and punished for what it has deserved.
Lord, do not punish us if we forget or make a mistake. Lord, do not burden us as You burdened those before us. Lord, do not burden us with what we cannot bear. Forgive us, grant us Your forgiveness and Your mercy. You are our Protector, so help us against the disbelieving people."

1.translation:
"In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

You alone we worship and You alone we ask for help.
Guide us to the straight path,
the path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked anger or of those who are astray."

nurAfiyah.title: ðŸŒ¿âœ¨ Nur al-'Afiyah â€“ Prophetic Remedies ðŸŒ¿âœ¨
nurAfiyah.description: These remedies are drawn from the Sunnah and the Quran, used for centuries for healing and well-being. The Prophet ï·º taught us simple, natural, and blessed means to preserve our physical and spiritual health. For each remedy, you can recite Quranic verses over it via the Nur al-Qur'an section, to increase baraka and healing power.
nurAfiyah.reminder: For each remedy, you can recite verses from Nur al-Qur'an over it to increase baraka and spiritual effect. These remedies are simple, safe, and directly inspired by prophetic guidance.

1.name: Honey
1.source: Quran 16:69 â€“ "â€¦wherein is healing for people."
1.usage: One spoon on an empty stomach or mixed with warm water.
1.benefits: Purifies the body, strengthens immunity, soothes throat and fatigue.

2.name: Black seed
2.source: Sunnah â€“ Sahih Bukhari & Muslim: "Black seed heals every disease except death."
2.usage: 1 to 2 g per day, alone or mixed with honey.
2.benefits: Strengthens the immune system, fights diseases and mild infections.

3.name: Zamzam water
3.source: Sunnah â€“ used by the Prophet ï·º for drinking and healing.
3.usage: 1 to 2 glasses per day, ask for healing while drinking.
3.benefits: Purifies body and spirit, strengthens faith and answers some prayers.

4.name: Dates
4.source: Sunnah â€“ recommended in the morning and before fasting.
4.usage: 2 to 3 dates per day, alone or in warm water.
4.benefits: Quick energy, easy digestion, purifies the body.

5.name: Olive oil
5.source: Quran 24:35 â€“ "In the olive tree, there is oil, a source of light."
5.usage: Consume raw or apply to the body.
5.benefits: Nourishes, purifies, strengthens heart and body.

6.name: Jujube leaves
6.source: Sunnah â€“ used for purification and external care.
6.usage: Infusion or bath with a few leaves.
6.benefits: Purifies, calms the mind and relieves skin pain.

7.name: Milk
7.source: Quran 16:66 & Sunnah â€“ mentioned as pure and beneficial food.
7.usage: Drink plain or with a little honey.
7.benefits: Strengthens the body, purifies and brings energy and vitality.

8.name: Vinegar
8.source: Sunnah â€“ recommended to accompany meals and purify.
8.usage: One spoon in meals or mixed with water.

9.name: Ginger
9.source: Quran 76:17 â€“ cited among blessed foods of paradise and Sunnah.
9.usage: Infusion, decoction or mixed with honey and lemon.
9.benefits: Warms, improves circulation and digestion, strengthens immunity.

10.name: Warm water and salt
10.source: Sunnah â€“ used for gargling, foot bath or hygiene.
10.usage: Gargle for sore throat, foot bath for fatigue.
10.benefits: Purifies, relieves pain and mild inflammation.

11.name: Lemon
11.source: Sunnah / Tibb an-Nabawi â€“ tones and purifies the body.
11.usage: Warm water with lemon juice or add to food.
11.benefits: Strengthens the immune system, purification, digestion.

12.name: Fumigation / blessed incense
12.source: Sunnah â€“ used to purify house and air, ward off evil.
12.usage: Burn a few sticks or powder in a room.
12.benefits: Purifies the air, spiritually protects and brings positive energy.

This feature requires a Premium account.

To access the AI chat and fully enjoy all advanced features, please activate your Premium account now.

AYNA Premium gives you full access to AI tools: advanced analyses, unlimited access, and exclusive features to enhance your experience and get the most out of artificial intelligence.
subscription.zakaatMessage:
But AYNA Premium is not only access to powerful tools. It is also an act of solidarity. More than 10% of the funds collected from Premium activations are donated to humanitarian organizations as Zakaat, to directly support those most in need. By activating your account, you contribute to a project where everyone benefits: you get advanced AI, and at the same time you take part in a concrete action to help those who need it most.

Activate your Premium account to unlock all features and join a project built on sharing, mutual support, and kindness. Your contribution makes a real difference, and every activation is a step toward a more supportive world.

To continue using the AI chat and fully enjoy Premium features, activate your account now and be part of this initiative that combines technology and solidarity.
